title: Biometric System Definitions
critical_for: Article 5 prohibited practices, Article 6 high-risk classification

biometric_data.definition: Personal data resulting from specific technical processing relating to the physical, physiological or behavioural characteristics of a natural person, such as facial images or dactyloscopic data

elements.element: Relating to physical, physiological or behavioural characteristics

biometric_identification.definition: The automated recognition of physical, physiological, behavioural, or psychological human features for the purpose of establishing the identity of a natural person by comparing biometric data of that individual to biometric data of individuals stored in a database

biometric_verification.definition: The automated, one-to-one verification, including authentication, of the identity of natural persons by comparing their biometric data to previously provided biometric data
biometric_verification.critical_distinction: VERIFICATION (one-to-one, confirm claimed identity) vs IDENTIFICATION (one-to-many, establish unknown identity)
biometric_verification.regulatory_treatment: Generally NOT covered by strict prohibitions - lower risk

emotion_recognition_system.definition: An AI system for the purpose of identifying or inferring emotions or intentions of natural persons on the basis of their biometric data

cumulative_elements.element: Purpose: identifying or inferring emotions or intentions
cumulative_elements.flag: MEDIUM_CONFIDENCE: 'emotions' and 'intentions' are distinct concepts - broad scope

emotion_recognition_system.regulatory_treatment: Prohibited in workplace and education per Article 5(1)(f) with medical/safety exception
emotion_recognition_system.interpretative_note: Recital 18 clarifies excludes physical states (pain, fatigue) and mere detection of expressions without emotion inference

biometric_categorisation_system.definition: An AI system for the purpose of assigning natural persons to specific categories on the basis of their biometric data, unless it is ancillary to another commercial service and strictly necessary for objective technical reasons

cumulative_elements.element: Purpose: assigning persons to specific categories
cumulative_elements.flag: MEDIUM_CONFIDENCE: 'specific categories' undefined - race, age, gender, etc.

exclusion.text: UNLESS ancillary to another commercial service AND strictly necessary for objective technical reasons
exclusion.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'ancillary' and 'strictly necessary for objective technical reasons' highly interpretative

biometric_categorisation_system.regulatory_treatment: Prohibited per Article 5(1)(g) when inferring sensitive attributes (race, religion, etc.) with law enforcement exception

remote_biometric_identification_system.definition: An AI system for the purpose of identifying natural persons, without their active involvement, typically at a distance through the comparison of a person's biometric data with the biometric data contained in a reference database
remote_biometric_identification_system.critical_distinction: REMOTE (passive, at distance, mass surveillance capable) vs direct/cooperative
remote_biometric_identification_system.regulatory_treatment: Real-time variant heavily restricted per Article 5(1)(h) and 5(2)-(7)

realtime_remote_biometric_identification.definition: A remote biometric identification system, whereby the capturing of biometric data, the comparison and the identification all occur without a significant delay, comprising not only instant identification, but also limited short delays in order to avoid circumvention

cumulative_elements.element: Capturing, comparison, and identification occur without significant delay
Includes instant AND limited short delays
cumulative_elements.note: Anti-circumvention: brief buffering still counts as real-time

realtime_remote_biometric_identification.regulatory_treatment: Prohibited per Article 5(1)(h) EXCEPT narrow law enforcement exceptions with prior authorization
realtime_remote_biometric_identification.interpretative_challenge: 'Significant delay' boundary unclear - minutes? hours? Intent: live surveillance vs forensic

post_remote_biometric_identification_sys.definition: A remote biometric identification system other than a real-time remote biometric identification system
post_remote_biometric_identification_sys.description: Remote biometric ID with significant delay - forensic/retrospective analysis
post_remote_biometric_identification_sys.regulatory_treatment: Less restrictive than real-time but still regulated

regulatory_hierarchy.most_restricted: Real-time remote biometric identification in publicly accessible spaces for law enforcement
regulatory_hierarchy.heavily_regulated: Post-remote biometric identification, emotion recognition (workplace/education), biometric categorisation (sensitive attributes)
regulatory_hierarchy.context_dependent: General biometric systems depending on use case and classification

critical_distinctions_summary.identification_vs_verification: One-to-many (who is this?) vs One-to-one (is this person X?)
critical_distinctions_summary.categorisation_vs_identification: Assign to category vs establish specific identity
